summary: Build an app for an Indian Chettinad restaurant to manage daily sales, expenses, petty cash, inventory, and profit & loss reporting.
architectural_notes: Expenses entries should include a classification field (Fixed vs Variable) and reporting/UI should support filtering and totals by this classification.

existing_features.title: Build a frontend UI with navigation for: Dashboard, Sales, Expenses, Petty Cash, Inventory, and Reports. Each section must allow adding new records and viewing lists with date filtering.
Implement frontend workflows for editing and deleting Sales and Expenses entries with confirmation prompts and success/error toasts.
Implement frontend petty cash ledger UI: add cash IN/OUT transactions, show current balance prominently, and show a transaction list filtered by date range.
Implement frontend inventory UI: manage item master list (add/edit), record stock movements per item, and display current stock levels with low-stock highlighting.
Implement frontend Profit & Loss reporting UI: for a selected date range show total sales, total expenses, net profit/loss, and expense totals by category.

Apply a cohesive visual theme suitable for an Indian Chettinad restaurant ledger app, using warm earthy colors (no blue/purple as primary), clear typography, and a clean form-first layout that is consistent across all pages.

Generate and include basic brand assets as static images and use them in the UI (e.g., app logo in header and a subtle background pattern on auth-free landing/dashboard screens) by placing them under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Add the user-uploaded logo image file(s) (Restaurant_1.png and Restaurant_1-1.png) to the frontend static assets and update the app header to display the uploaded logo instead of the currently referenced generated logo (/assets/generated/chettinad-logo.dim_512x512.png).
Ensure the updated header logo includes appropriate accessible alt text in English that matches the restaurant branding shown in the uploaded logo image.
Update the Expenses UI to allow selecting Fixed vs Variable when creating or editing an expense, and display the classification in the expense entries list.

Add filtering in the Expenses page to view All expenses, only Fixed expenses, or only Variable expenses, applying the filter in the existing filters area corresponding to the selected element (/html/body/div/div/main/div/div[2]/div[2]/div[1]/div[2]).
Update Profit & Loss reporting calculations to compute and show totals for Fixed expenses and Variable expenses for the selected date range.

new_feature_requests.summary: Track and record daily sales for the restaurant
Inventory management for restaurant items (stock in/out, current levels)
Generate profit & loss reporting based on sales, expenses, and inventory
Create a backend data model and CRUD APIs to record daily sales entries for the restaurant, including date, total amount, optional notes, and created/updated timestamps.
Create a backend data model and CRUD APIs to record daily expense entries, including date, category, amount, payment method (e.g., cash/bank), optional notes, and created/updated timestamps.

Implement petty cash management in the backend with a ledger of transactions (cash in/cash out) and a computed current balance. Each transaction must include date/time, type (IN/OUT), amount, reason/notes, and created/updated timestamps.

Implement inventory management in the backend for restaurant items, including item master data (name, unit, optional low-stock threshold) and stock movement transactions (stock in, stock out, adjustments) with date/time, quantity, and notes.
Implement backend Profit & Loss reporting APIs that compute totals for a selected date range: total sales, total expenses, net profit/loss, and optionally a category breakdown for expenses.
Add the user-provided logo asset to the app (use it in the header/branding in place of or alongside the generated logo)
Enhance Expenses tracking to support separating/classifying expenses as Fixed vs Variable (for entry and reporting/filtering)

Extend the ExpenseEntry data model to include an expense classification field that distinguishes Fixed expenses from Variable expenses, and expose this field through the backend API used by the frontend.

projectName: Chettinad Restaurant Daily Accounting: Sales, Expenses, Petty Cash, Inventory, and P&L
